RT @thelexington: We've launched a crowdfund as we need to ask for your help. We're committed to paying our staff in full for as long as po

@TedneyNash @laurendown @Photo_Parri @Cerysimo @kitrichardsonuk @TylerDamara @alexcornetto @KCBobCut @remotepostmusic @fenderqueer @pkinsella2 @putnam39 @howtojesswell @scrtmeetingblog @Dave_Rowlinson Right back atcha - thanks for pulling all this together!
RT @TedneyNash: I asked some of the finest music writers (and me) from the @bestfitmusic family friends community to choose their nine pi
@TedneyNash Good luck; godspeed!
NINE SONGS #4 cause I missed it - Sigur Rs were unlike anything I'd ever heard at the time when Takk... came out. So transportive and visual. https://t.co/dwZojBzUgM
NINE SONGS #9 - Almost certainly the band that kickstarted my love of Scandi music. 156 remains one of my favourite songs ever. https://t.co/QPWimPVbQc
NINE SONGS #8 - This was a song on the first album I ever reviewed for @bestfitmusic back in 2012. I haven't listened to it in years but it definitely had an impact. https://t.co/HYQkk63ZLH
(No slight to Linkin Park there, they are amazing, but I think I bought a bunch of OPM singles straight away afterwards after realising I could choose my own music)

NINE SONGS #7 - Linkin Park's Hybrid Theory was the first album I bought (though I got Eiffel 65's debut as a present). Was the start of me finding my own music instead of leeching off my parents, who in hindsight had much better taste than I did. https://t.co/HU6dgxDkTi

NINE SONGS #6 - Cocteau Twins were a mainstay of my childhood as both parents loved them. I was apparently born while Heaven Or Las Vegas (this song in particular) was playing. https://t.co/JbLECMziir

NINE SONGS #5 - Weekend In The City is almost certainly my favourite album of all time, and I think this was the first track I heard from it when my Dad was playing it in the car. https://t.co/oNBFms4Fds

NINE SONGS #3 - sorry @TedneyNash, I've been pants at this. The first song I loved that I discovered 8tracks (if anyone remembers that) in about 2008 as I started to realise there was more music than pop-punk in the world. https://t.co/IC0nSZIU91

NINE SONGS #2 - Take Me Out by @Franz_Ferdinand. My first gig was FF at Portsmouth Guildhall in 2004, and they were first band I properly loved. Still know all the words that debut. https://t.co/o1KzzS7aoq

NINE SONGS #1 - Here Comes Your Man by @PIXIES. Doolittle is amazing + was always playing when I was a kid, but I can only pick one song from it, and I had this one on while I got married. Go @CharKrol @howtojesswell @lukepcartledge @alexleethomson https://t.co/hnABRSZgLs
@TedneyNash has started nominating people to do their own personal Nine Songs (from @bestfitmusic's long-running series: https://t.co/ds9NxH5dzx), which is a brilliant idea, and I'm up.
@paulbridgewater @sxsw @nastycherryband @buzzardbuzzard @mypizzagirl @lauranhibberd @MurderCapital_ @beachtapeband @jenlong
